channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Van Jones says Kamala Harris picked Tim Walz over Josh Shapiro because...
item.description: CNN commentator Van Jones said Tuesday that Pennsylvania governor Josh Shapiro was sidestepped by Kamala Harris because he is Jewish. Kamala Harris picking Minnesota governor Tim Walz "was her caving in to some of these darker parts in the party" in terms of appeasing "anti-Jewish bigots" that have "gotten marbled into this party", Van Jones said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: When Tim Walz spoke about IVF, 'chidlless cat ladies'
item.description: Tim Walz is not a 'childless cat lady' as JD Vance would like to describe some Democrats but the father of two is very open about his wife's struggle to conceive and then opting for IVF to become parents. Tim and Gwen Walz have two children : 23-year-old Hope and 17-year-old Gus Walz.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'JD Vance is fu****': Tim Walz memes take over Internet as Harris announces VP pick
item.description: Minnesota Guv Tim Walz, as Kamala Harris' VP pick, is up against JD Vance in the November election as the name was announced Tuesday. Harris personally delivered the message to Walz in a video call as the search narrowed down between Walz and Josh Shapiro. Harris and Walz did not share a deep bond but Walz catapulted himself on the election stage as he came up with the most powerful campaign for Kamala Harris that Republicans are 'weird'.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala's progressive Walz to the left
item.description: Kamala Harris announced Tim Walz as her running mate for the 2024 Presidential election, opting for a progressive platform. Walz, the Governor of Minnesota, is known for his strong left-liberal policies and recent viral remarks against Trump Republicans. Josh Shapiro, a centrist choice, was passed over due to his pro-Israel stance.
item.dc:creator: Chidanand Rajghatta

item.title: US leaders laud Biden's Indo-Pacific diplomacy, says it has made America's future 'more secure'
item.description: US National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan and other officials explained how President Biden's Indo-Pacific strategy has enhanced security and prosperity. They highlighted new alliances like AUKUS, the elevation of the Quad, and economic initiatives, emphasizing the region's critical importance to global GDP and US jobs. Key security improvements and cooperative efforts were also underscored.

item.title: 10 things to know about Tim Walz who said 'Black woman kicked his a**' in praise for Harris
item.description: Tim Walz does not drink alcohol or coffee and his favorite beverage is Mountain Dew. He's the one who called the Republicans weird and jumpstarted Kamala campaign with a lighter, jazzy approach.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Like San Francisco, Minneapolis...': Republicans slam 'Harris-Walz' ticket as extreme radical
item.description: Tim Walz controversies resurfaced Tuesday after he was named the vice presidential nominee of Kamala Harris as the Republicans called Harris-Walz the most dangerously incompetent ticket in history. Walz faced criticism for his response to George Floyd protests which took place a year into his first term as governor. In May 2020, Minneapolis police officer was filmed murdering George Floyd followed by major protest looting, arson and violence.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Bangladesh army carries out major reshuffle in top command amid unrest
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: â€‹What Obama thought about controversial Shapiro, possible VP pick of Kamala Harris
item.description: Josh Shapiro's speaking style is very similar to Barrack Obama but their connection is stronger than this. They know each other since 2006 and Obama for day one thought that Josh has a very high political ceiling. As a probable VP pick of Kamala Harris, Josh is facing scrutiny from his party as well because of his stand on Israel. JD Vance said Shapiro sounds like a bad imitation of Obama
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why is Iran expected to attack Israel? What to know about the crisis
Hezbollah strikes northern Israel; warns of retaliation over commander's death
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Iran executes man accused of murder during Mahsa Amini unrest
item.description: Iran executed a 34-year-old man for killing a security officer during protests triggered by the death of Mahsa Amini in police custody. Reza Rasaei was convicted for the murder of an intelligence chief and sentenced to death after an allegedly unfair trial. His execution marks the first protest-related execution since the new president took office.

item.title: Iraq condemns 'reckless' attacks on bases
item.description: Iraq's military condemned actions against its bases and captured a truck with a rocket launcher after at least five US personnel were injured in an attack. This incident occurred amidst rising tension in the Middle East due to the Gaza war and fears of reprisals by Iran and its allies. The military is investigating to bring the perpetrators to justice.

item.title: Bangladesh ex-PM Khaleda Zia freed after arch-rival Sheikh Hasina toppled amid unrest
item.description: Bangladesh's uncompromising ex-prime minister Khaleda Zia has been released from years of house arrest after her bitter enemy Sheikh Hasina was ousted as premier and fled as protesters stormed her palace. She was later released into house arrest on condition she neither took part in politics nor went abroad for medical treatment.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: What is Jamaat-e-Islami? 'Pakistan-backed' political party that brought down Sheikh Hasina govt in Bangladesh
item.description: Amid widespread violent protests, Bangladesh's Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina resigned and fled to India. Army chief General Waker-uz-Zaman announced an interim government and military control to restore order. Jamaat-e-Islami, an influential Islamist party, has faced bans and crackdowns due to its history of violent activities and extremist connections, presenting ongoing challenges for Bangladesh's stability.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Maitree Express between Dhaka and Kolkata remains suspended
Who is Nahid Islam, soft-spoken sociology student leader behind fall of Bangladesh government
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who was Sheikh Mujibur Rahman? Architect of independent Bangladesh
item.description: Amid political unrest in Bangladesh, Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina resigned and sought refuge in India. This situation mirrors her earlier exile nearly 48 years ago, following the assassination of her father, Sheikh Mujibur Rahman, along with his family. Rahman was Bangladesh's first president, whose death in a military coup led to successive coups and power struggles.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: How Israel's Mossad took down enemy with Belgian chocolates and toothpaste laced with poison
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Caught on camera: Pickup truck slams into pedestrians on NYC sidewalk
item.description: A shocking event took place in Harlem when a pickup truck lost control, mounted the sidewalk, and struck two pedestrians. The incident occurred around 4:50 p.m. at the intersection of St. Nicholas Avenue and West 148th Street. Both victims were hospitalized and are in stable condition, while the driver remained uninjured and on the scene.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
